source:
veteran actor robert hardy is selling his enormous collection of antiques in a £ 100,000 auction after deciding to downsize his home .
the star , known for appearing in all creatures great and small and playing winston churchill several times , is auctioning off more than 200 items he has collected over his career .
mr hardy , 89 , is a keen military historian who studied english with j.r.r. tolkien and is now an expert on the medieval longbow .
sale : actor robert hardy is selling off his collection of antiques including a diorama of the battle of agincourt
cabinets : a pair of early victorian items of furniture made by gillows of lancaster which are set to fetch up to £ 4,000 at the auction on saturday
portrait : a painting of mr hardy holding a longbow , reflecting his interest in medieval history
one of the most unusual items featured in the auction of his possessions is a hand-painted limewood diorama depicted the progress of the battle of agincourt in 3d .
the piece was created by artist l.m. rendall in the 1960s after being commissioned by mr hardy himself , and has an estimate of £ 4,000 to £ 6,000 .
there is also a longbow made from yew with a mother-of-pearl handle , as well as a portrait of mr hardy holding the bow , which is set to sell for up to £ 2,000 .
the actor is also selling paintings , furniture , swords , flintlock rifles , silverware and a fine collection of crystal chandeliers .
diorama : the 3d model was commissioned specially by mr hardy from artist l.m. rendall in the 1960s
close-up : the piece was rendered in amazing detail showing the progress of the battle in 1415
luxurious : a view of many of the items of furniture and other antiques which are being sold
dozens of books , some dating back to the 17th century , are included in the auction which is set to take place this saturday .
a total of 238 lots are being sold by dominic winter auctioneers at its saleroom in south cerney , gloucestershire .
mr hardy , who lives in the cotswolds , said that he was sad to sell his collection .
` downsizing and losing a great part of a treasured library makes for sadness , ' he said .
` entrusting it all to dominic winter and co has taken away much of the pain , and through them i wish anyone who comes to possess anything that was mine as much joy and pleasure as it has given me through the years . '
historical : an early 20th-century painting of alfred the great rebuilding london , by frank owen salisbury
auction : the objects are being sold at dominic winter in gloucestershire on saturday
pride : mr hardy pictured in 2012 with the longbow and other objects from his collection
he has built up the haul of antiques thanks to his interest in classic literature and military history .
mr hardy was taught by tolkien and c.s. lewis when he studied english at magdalen college , oxford , and he has published two books on the history of the longbow .
he was also consulted as an expert during the raising of the tudor shipwreck the mary rose .
mr hardy , a close friend of richard burton , worked with top actors including laurence olivier , john gielgud and judi dench during his early days as a shakespearean specialist .
he found national fame playing vet siegfried farnon in all creatures great and small , the hit bbc drama which aired between 1978 and 1994 and also starred lynda bellingham .
star : mr hardy , left , is known for his role as vet siegriein the bbc 's all creatures great and small
role : he has frequently played winston churchill in a series of television dramas
new generation : mr hardy appeared as minister for magic cornelius fudge in the harry potter films
the actor is well known for portraying winston churchill in a number of television performances , and has also played churchill 's fellow second world war leader franklin d. roosevelt .
more recently , he introduced himself to a younger generation of viewers with an appearance in the harry potter films , where he played cornelius fudge , the minister for magic .
mr hardy was forced to retire from stage acting two years ago , when he suffered a fall while playing churchill again in the audience , a west end play about the queen which starred helen mirren .
however , he has insisted that he will continue to do television work despite his advanced age .
summary: Veteran actor Robert Hardy, known for roles in All Creatures Great and Small, playing Winston Churchill several times, and more recently in the Harry Potter films, is downsizing his home and selling his extensive collection of antiques in a £100,000 auction. The collection includes over 200 items such as furniture, paintings, swords, flintlock rifles, silverware, crystal chandeliers, and books dating back to the 17th century. Notable items include a hand-painted limewood diorama of the Battle of Agincourt, a longbow made from yew with a mother-of-pearl handle, and a portrait of Hardy holding the bow. The diorama, created by artist L.M. Rendall in the 1960s, is estimated to sell for £4,000 to £6,000, while the longbow and portrait are expected to fetch up to £2,000. The auction will take place at Dominic Winter Auctioneers in Gloucestershire on Saturday. Hardy, who lives in the Cotswolds

summary: Veteran actor Robert Hardy, known for his roles in "All Creatures Great and Small" and portraying Winston Churchill, is selling his collection of antiques, including a 3D diorama of the Battle of Agincourt, for £100,000 in a £100,000 auction. The collection, which includes furniture, swords, flintlock rifles, silverware, and crystal chandeliers, is being sold by Dominic Winter Auctioneers in Gloucestershire. Hardy, 89, is downsizing his home and has expressed sadness at parting with his treasured library. The auction, featuring over 200 items, will take place on Saturday and includes a painting of Hardy with a longbow, a diorama commissioned by Hardy in the 1960s, and a historical painting of Alfred the Great. Hardy's interest in classic literature and military history has contributed to his collection, and he has also appeared in the Harry Potter films as Minister for Magic Cornelius Fudge. summary:
Here's a concise summary of the passage covering the core information:

Veteran actor Robert Hardy, 89, is auctioning off his extensive collection of antiques, estimated to be worth £100,000, as he downsizes his home. The collection includes over 200 items gathered throughout his career, reflecting his interests in military history and medieval longbows. Notable items in the auction include:

1. A hand-painted limewood diorama of the Battle of Agincourt
2. A yew longbow with a mother-of-pearl handle
3. Paintings, furniture, weapons, silverware, and crystal chandeliers
4. Rare books, some dating back to the 17th century

The auction, consisting of 238 lots, will be held by Dominic Winter Auctioneers in Gloucestershire. Hardy, known for roles in "All Creatures Great and Small" and as Winston Churchill in various productions, expressed sadness at parting with his collection but hopes the new owners will derive as much joy from the items as he has. summary: Robert Hardy, an 89-year-old veteran actor and military historian, is auctioning off his extensive collection of antiques, valued at £100,000. The collection includes over 200 items, such as a diorama of the Battle of Agincourt, Victorian furniture, paintings, swords, rifles, silverware, and chandeliers. Hardy, known for his roles in 'All Creatures Great and Small' and as Winston Churchill, has a passion for military history and classic literature, which influenced his antique collection. The auction will be held by Dominic Winter Auctioneers in Gloucestershire, featuring 238 lots, including rare books and historical items.

summary: Veteran actor Robert Hardy, 89, is auctioning over 200 antiques and collectibles, including a 3D diorama of the Battle of Agincourt, to downsize his home. The collection, valued at £100,000, includes furniture, paintings, weapons, and books, and reflects his interests in military history and classic literature. Hardy, known for roles like Winston Churchill and Vet Siegfried Farnon, is also an expert on the medieval longbow. He plans to use the auction to spread joy and pleasure to new owners, as downsizing brings him sadness.

summary:
Here is a concise summary of the passage:

Robert Hardy, an 89-year-old veteran actor, is selling his extensive collection of over 200 antiques, including a £4,000-£6,000 diorama of the Battle of Agincourt, at a £100,000 auction in Gloucestershire. The collection, built over his career, reflects his interests in medieval history, military history, and classic literature. Hardy, known for his roles in "All Creatures Great and Small" and "Harry Potter", has been forced to downsize his home and is sad to part with his treasured possessions, but is entrusting their sale to Dominic Winter Auctioneers.

` entrusting it all to dominic winter and co has taken away much of the pain , and through them i wish anyone who comes to possess anything that was mine as much joy and pleasure as it has given me through the years . '
historical : an early 20th-century painting of alfred the great rebuilding london , by frank owen salisbury
auction : the objects are being sold at dominic winter in gloucestershire on saturday
pride : mr hardy pictured in 2012 with the longbow and other objects from his collection
he has built up the haul of antiques thanks to his interest in classic literature and military history .
mr hardy was taught by tolkien and c.s. lewis when he studied english at magdalen college , oxford , and he has published two books on the history of the longbow .
he was also consulted as an expert during the raising of the tudor shipwreck the mary rose .
mr hardy , a close friend of richard burton , worked with top actors including laurence olivier , john gielgud and judi dench during his early days as a shakespearean specialist .
he found national fame playing vet siegfried farnon in all creatures great and small , the hit bbc drama which aired between 1978 and 1994 and also starred lynda bellingham .
star : mr hardy , left , is known for his role as vet siegriein the bbc 's all creatures great and small
role : he has frequently played winston churchill in a series of television dramas
new generation : mr hardy appeared as minister for magic cornelius fudge in the harry potter films
the actor is well known for portraying winston churchill in a number of television performances , and has also played churchill 's fellow second world war leader franklin d. roosevelt .
more recently , he introduced himself to a younger generation of viewers with an appearance in the harry potter films , where he played cornelius fudge , the minister for magic .
mr hardy was forced to retire from stage acting two years ago , when he suffered a fall while playing churchill again in the audience , a west end play about the queen which starred helen mirren .
however , he has insisted that he will continue to do television work despite his advanced age .
summary:
Here is a concise summary of the passage, covering the core pieces of information described:

Veteran actor Robert Hardy, 89, is selling his vast collection of over 200 antiques, including furniture, paintings, swords, and a 3D diorama of the Battle of Agincourt, in a £100,000 auction. The sale is due to Hardy's decision to downsize his home. The collection, which includes items such as a longbow made from yew and a portrait of Hardy holding the bow, reflects his interests in military history and medieval history. The auction will take place on Saturday at Dominic Winter Auctioneers in Gloucestershire, with 238 lots up for sale. Hardy, who has had a long and distinguished career, including roles in "All Creatures Great and Small" and as Winston Churchill, has expressed sadness at parting with his collection but hopes it will bring joy to its new owners.

veteran actor robert hardy is selling his enormous collection of antiques in a £ 100,000 auction after deciding to downsize his home .
the star , known for appearing in all creatures great and small and playing winston churchill several times , is auctioning off more than 200 items he has collected over his career .
mr hardy , 89 , is a keen military historian who studied english with j.r.r. tolkien and is now an expert on the medieval longbow .
sale : actor robert hardy is selling off his collection of antiques including a diorama of the battle of agincourt
cabinets : a pair of early victorian items of furniture made by gillows of lancaster which are set to fetch up to £ 4,000 at the auction on saturday
portrait : a painting of mr hardy holding a longbow , reflecting his interest in medieval history
one of the most unusual items featured in the auction of his possessions is a hand-painted limewood diorama depicted the progress of the battle of agincourt in 3d .
the piece was created by artist l.m. rendall in the 1960s after being commissioned by mr hardy himself , and has an estimate of £ 4,000 to £ 6,000 .
there is also a longbow made from yew with a mother-of-pearl handle , as well as a portrait of mr hardy holding the bow , which is set to sell for up to £ 2,000 .
the actor is also selling paintings , furniture , swords , flintlock rifles , silverware and a fine collection of crystal chandeliers .
diorama : the 3d model was commissioned specially by mr hardy from artist l.m. rendall in the 1960s
close-up : the piece was rendered in amazing detail showing the progress of the battle in 1415
luxurious : a view of many of the items of furniture and other antiques which are being sold
dozens of books , some dating back to the 17th century , are included in the auction which is set to take place this saturday .
a total of 238 lots are being sold by dominic winter auctioneers at its saleroom in south cerney , gloucestershire .
mr hardy , who lives in the cotswolds , said that he was sad to sell his collection .
` downsizing and losing a great part of a treasured library makes for sadness , ' he said .
` entrusting it all to dominic winter and co has taken away much of the pain , and through them i wish anyone who comes to possess anything that was mine as much joy and pleasure as it has given me through the years . '

summary: Robert Hardy, a veteran actor known for his roles in "All Creatures Great and Small" and as Winston Churchill, is selling his collection of antiques at auction. The collection includes over 200 items, including a diorama of the Battle of Agincourt, furniture, paintings, swords, rifles, silverware, and chandeliers. Hardy, a keen military historian, studied English with J.R.R. Tolkien and is an expert on the medieval longbow. He is selling the collection because he is downsizing his home. The auction will take place on Saturday at Dominic Winter Auctioneers in Gloucestershire.

summary: Veteran actor Robert Hardy is selling his collection of antiques in a £100,000 auction in order to downsize his home. The auction includes over 200 items that Hardy has collected over his career, including a hand-painted limewood diorama of the Battle of Agincourt, a longbow made from yew, paintings, furniture, swords, flintlock rifles, silverware, crystal chandeliers, and dozens of books. The auction is being held by Dominic Winter Auctioneers in Gloucestershire and includes a total of 238 lots. Hardy, known for his roles in "All Creatures Great and Small" and for playing Winston Churchill, is a keen military historian and has published books on the history of the longbow. Despite retiring from stage acting, Hardy plans to continue working in television.

summary: Veteran actor Robert Hardy, known for roles in "All Creatures Great and Small" and as Winston Churchill, is auctioning his extensive collection of antiques worth £100,000 due to downsizing. The auction includes over 200 items, such as a detailed diorama of the Battle of Agincourt, a yew longbow, paintings, furniture, swords, rifles, silverware, and crystal chandeliers. Hardy, 89, a military historian and expert on the medieval longbow, expressed sadness over parting with his collection but hopes new owners will find joy in them. The auction, managed by Dominic Winter Auctioneers, features 238 lots and will take place in Gloucestershire. Hardy, who studied under J.R.R. Tolkien and C.S. Lewis, has published books on the longbow and contributed to the Mary Rose shipwreck project. He gained fame as Siegfried Farnon and appeared in the Harry Potter films as Cornelius Fudge. Despite retiring from stage acting after a fall, he plans to continue television work.
